history.content:
Grad schools don't care about your diploma, only your transcript.

That being said, they don't even care about your majors, much less your minors. All that matters is the classes you took. For all they care, you could be an art history major but as long as you take the basic requirements for graduate study, they'll admit you assuming you have satisfied all the other criteria.

For example, if you're interested in a ML PhD, it doesn't matter what your major is as long as you take 126/127/182/189/(domain-specific grad class) and get As or A+s, and also have relevant research. The only benefit that having the "correct" major gives you is that you have priority enrollment for the classes you want.
